modelName: Class words in Data Element Naming

properties.name: Amount
properties.description:
Specifically about currency; A quantity of money - a monetary amount. Any valid monetary
Examples: amount value

* Annual Rent Amount
* Earned Premium Amount
* Per Occurrence Limit Amount
* Premium Discount Amount

Note: Also consider the possibility of Count classword.

properties.name: Code
properties.description:
A short alphanumeric value that represents a longer, fuller name or description of an Defined Allowed
object, thing, or classification belonging to a set of defined allowed values. Values, usually in a
Examples: set

* Company Code
* Diagnosis Code
* Postal State Code
* Vehicle Type Code

Note: Also consider the possibility of Name or Number classword.

properties.name: Constant
properties.description:
Data that does not change value from one transaction to another. Considered for A numeric,
reference values that should not or rarely change. alphabetic, or
Examples: alphanumeric value
* Print Mask Constant that rarely if ever
* Column Heading Constant changes.
* Tax Multiplier Constant

Note: Also consider the possibility of Text classword

properties.name: Count
properties.description:
An arithmetic value or quantity {including fractions and units of measure) of anything Any valid numeric
except money. Could also be used in or be the result of a mathematical computation like | value or decimal
an average, minimum, maximum, etc. value
Examples:

* Previous Month Total Claim Count
* Premium Discount Factor Count
* Square Footage Count
* Vehicle Mileage Count
* Maximum Payload Capacity Count

Note: Also consider the possibility of Percent or Amount classwords.

properties.name: Date
properties.description:
Actual calendar date.
Examples:
* Accident Date
* Birth Date
* Buyer Signing Date
* Expiration Date
* New Hire Date
* Purchase Date

Note: Also consider the related Time and Timestamp classwords

properties.name: Document
properties.description:
Formatted data which can contain several data elements with defined contents and
structure such as:, ADO, AJAX, ASP, CSS, CSV, DHTML, DOM, DTD, HTML, JavaScript,
JSON, PHP, RSS, SQL, XHTML, XML, XSD, XSL, XSLT, etc. which must be interpreted
before use by a system or application, and may represent a portion of a data file.

**Note:** One benefit of the Document classword is that the data elements contained within are flexible due to defined contents can change from within one record to the next.

Examples:
* Claim Document
* Coverage Document
* Pricing Rule Set Input Document
* Pricing Rule Set Output Document
* Structure Feature Document
* Vehicle Feature Document

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of File or Text classword

properties.name: File
properties.description:
A digital “container” of data that represents Images; Sound, Video executables, etc that
have a computer file extension like “.JPG”, “WAV”, “MOV”, “EXE”, “PDF”, “ZIP”, etc
Examples:
* Claim Scene Image File
* Claim Property Loss Video File
* Window Procedures Sound File

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of the Document classword

properties.name: Identifier
properties.description:
A meaningless value (often sequentially or randomly generated) that uniquely represents an occurrence of a record about an object, entity, or thing, including a specific person or
organization.
Examples:
* Contract Identifier
* Project Identifier
* Property Identifier
* Party Identifier
* Taxpayer Identifier

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of the Name or Number classwords

properties.name: Indicator
properties.description:
A value limited to four different status types in regard to the existence or presence of a situation or condition.

**Note:** "No" is sometimes used as a default placeholder, until the status of the condition is checked in process, later resulting in a "Yes", overlaying the "No". In some cases the reverse can be the "Yes" is used as a default value, until the condition is checked, resulting a "No", overlaying the "Yes". If the Yes and No default does not work for specific application then the Unknown and  NotApplicable must be used for a default.

Examples:
* Appraisal Needed Indicator
* Multiple Line Discount Indicator
* Part Timing Employee Indicator
* Occasional Youthful Operator Indicator

**Note:** Also, consider the closely related class word, SWITCH; if condition statuses are to be expressed as Boolean values of “QO” or “1”. 

**Allowed values:**
Always one of the following literal (character ONLY) allowed values (max 13 characters): 
* “**Yes**” (Condition exists) 
* “**No**” (Condition does not exists)
* “**Unknown**” (Status of condition is unknown)
* “**NotApplicable**” (Condition and its status do not apply)

properties.name: Line
properties.description:
A spatial, geometric shape that defines a straight connection between two points or may | No distinct set of
extend infinitely in both directions. allowed values.
Examples:
* Longitude Line (represents different line positions from N to S poles)
* Prime Meridian Line (is always the entire line at 0 longitude from N to S poles)
* Forty Fourth Parallel Line
* Property Boundary Line
* Marketing Street Segment Line

**Note:** Also consider the related geospatial Point and Polygon classword

properties.name: Name
properties.description:
Meaningful alphabetic data using words which identifies a specific object or which may Allowed but optional
have known allowed values. It can also identify a type or category of an object or thing.
Examples:
* Building Name
* Occupation Name
* Company Name
* Party Last Name
* Data Location Type Name

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of the Identifier and Text classwords

properties.name: Number
properties.description:
Alphanumeric data not using words, which identifies a specific object or thing, but can Not applicable
also identify a type or category of an object or thing.
Examples:
* Telephone Number
* Model Number
* Tax Identification Number
* Serial Number
* Social Security Number
* Apartment Number
* Latitude Number (the location along the Longitude Line)
* Vehicle Model Year Number

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of Code, Count, Name, Identifier classword

properties.name: Percent
properties.description:
An arithmetic numeric expression based on the rate or proportion per hundred. 

Calculation Example: 
"DiscountPercentage": If a product has a discount of 20% (20/100 ratio; or part/whole), you would store it as 0.20 in the database. When displaying this value to users, you can format it as 20% using formatting functions. But it should be stored as a decimal for easier calculation and consistency for all storage of percentages. 

Examples: 
* Construction Retainage Percent 
* Project Completion Percent 
* Annual Interest Percent 
* Interest Ratio Percent 
* Premium Discount Percent

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of Count classword 


**Allowed values**: Typical stored decimal values range between 0 and +1 at any level of precision.
NOTE: In some situations a negative number can represent situations for  a decrease/loss. In 

aineis STUER A percentage can exceed +1when the percentage represents a proportion that has exceeded the whole or original quantity.

properties.name: Point
properties.description:
A spatial, geometric reference that defines the intersection of two coordinate lines. 

Examples:
* Claim Loss Accident Location Point
* Insured Risk Location Point
* Daily Distance Vehicle Driven Starting Point
* Corporate Building Location Point

**Note:** Also consider the related geospatial Line and Polygon classwords

properties.name: Polygon
properties.description:
A Spatial, geometric shape that defines a multi-sided geographic area.  

Examples: 
* Flood Zone Polygon
* Geographic County Polygon
* Illinois State Border Polygon
* Peril Risk Area Polygon

**Note:** Also consider the related geospatial Point and Line classwords

properties.name: Switch
properties.description:
Depending on the database management systems (DBMS) a boolean using a datatype of bit or byte (single character/number). The most common physical stored values will only have two condition statuses: “O” or “1”. Few may use “f” or “t”. Some DBMS also allow a NULL as the physical value. Best to consult the documentation of the specific DBMS for the details. 

**Note:** "O" is sometimes used as a default placeholder, until the status of the condition is checked in process, later resulting in a "1", overlaying the "O". In some cases the reverse can be the '1" is used as a default value, until the condition is checked, resulting a "0", overlaying the "1".

*Note: Though physically a switch bit can ONLY be physically stored as a “O” or “1”, in display or process assignment statements often “false” or “true” are displayed. 
Examples: 
* Cancellation Notice Sent Switch 
* =Multiple Line Discount Eligible Switch 
* Premium Payment Received Switch 
* Underwriter Review Request Switch

**Note:** Consider a closely related class word, INDICATOR, if condition statuses are not to be expressed as as “O” or “1”.

**Allowed values:** Always one of the following Boolean values: 
* “O"= Off, No, or False (Condition does not exists)
* “1’= On, Yes, or True (Condition exists)
* Null = Absence of Value (for the most part 0/1 are accepted and null are the exception when “not answered”)

properties.name: Text
properties.description:
Data having undefined content and/or unstructured format with no definable allowed values. Could be a free form description or comment about anything but does NOT specifically identify an object or thing.

Examples:
* Damage Description Text
* Loss Description Text
* Accident Description Text
* Name Address Print Label Text

**Note:** Also consider the possibility of Name, Contant, Document classwords

properties.name: Time
properties.description:
Actual clock time, which can be expressed in hours(military hours is usually best), Any valid time value minutes and sometimes seconds and smaller.

Examples:
* Option Expired Time
* Transaction Applied Time
* Appointment Time
* Store Closing Time

**Note:** Also consider the related Date and Timestamp classword

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description:
Hybrid DATE/TIME classword combination. 

Examples:
* Table Row Create Timestamp
* Communication Initiation Timestamp
* Queue Message Received Timestamp
* Systems Job Start Timestamp

*Note: Also consider the related Date and Time classword

**Allowed values:** Any valid timestamp value
